original_title: No bonuses for employees of gov bodies unless they earned profit: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Employees of any government bodies cannot be paid a bonus unless they made a profit, and part of that profit was paid to the consolidated fund, a minister said on Friday (22).

“Payment of bonus to the staff of Commercial Corporations, Statutory Boards and Government Owned Companies for the year 2023 should be granted if the institution have earned profits during the financial year 2022 and have paid at least 30% of the profit after tax as dividend to the Consolidated Fund,” State Minister of Finance Shehan Semasinghe said on X (twitter).

“If above said institutions have earned profits during the financial year 2022 but have not paid at least 30% of the profit after tax as dividend to the Consolidated Fund, or have recorded a loss during the financial year 2022 are not entitled to have a bonus based on the profitability of the institution.”

Addressing the 19th AGM of Inland Revenue Commissioners Association on Wednesday (20), Semasinghe also pointed out the critical role the IRD has to play in the sustainability of Sri Lanka’s economic recovery as “the country expects the IRD to discharge responsibilities with the highest level of diligence and focus.” (Colombo/Dec22/2023)
